pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:0.5: 1. The training rule on collections of almsbowls
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:0.6: Venerables, these thirty rules on relinquishment and confession come up for recitation.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.2: At that time the nuns from the group of six had collected a large number of almsbowls.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.3: When people walking about the dwellings saw this, they complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.4: “How can the nuns collect a large number of bowls? Will they start up as bowl merchants or set up a bowl shop?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.5: The nuns heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.6: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.7: “How can the nuns from the group of six collect bowls?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.8: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns from the group of six do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.11: “How can the nuns from the group of six collect bowls?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.13: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:1.14.1: ‘If a nun collects almsbowls, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.6: there are two kinds of bowls: the iron bowl and the ceramic bowl.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.7: And there are three sizes of bowls: the large bowl, the medium bowl, and the small bowl.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.9: it takes half an āḷhaka measure of boiled rice, a fourth part of fresh food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.11: it takes a nāḷika measure of boiled rice, a fourth part of fresh food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.13: it takes a pattha measure of boiled rice, a fourth part of fresh food, and a suitable amount of curry.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.14: Anything larger than this is not a bowl, nor anything smaller.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.16: almsbowls that have neither been determined nor assigned to another.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.19: The bowl is to be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.20: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21: After approaching the Sangha, that nun should put her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.22: ‘Venerables, this almsbowl, which I have kept for more than one day, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.23: After relinquishing it, she is to confess the offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.24: The confession should be received by a competent and capable nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.25: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.26: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.27: This almsbowl, which was to be relinquished by the nun so-and-so, has been relinquished to the Sangha.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.28: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give this bowl back to nun so-and-so.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.29: After approaching several nuns, that nun should put her upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior nuns. She should then squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.30: ‘Venerables, this almsbowl, which I have kept for more than one day, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to you.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.31: After relinquishing it, she is to confess the offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.32: The confession should be received by a competent and capable nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.33: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.34: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask you to listen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.35: This almsbowl, which was to be relinquished by the nun so-and-so, has been relinquished to you.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.36: If it seems appropriate to you, you should give this bowl back to nun so-and-so.’
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.37: After approaching a single nun, that nun should put her upper robe over one shoulder, squat on her heels, raise her joined palms, and say,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.38: ‘This almsbowl, which I have kept for more than one day, is to be relinquished.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.40: After relinquishing it, she is to confess the offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.41: The confession should be received by that nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.42: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.43: ‘I give this almsbowl back to you.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.1: If it is more than one day and she perceives it as more, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.2: If it is more than one day, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.3: If it is more than one day, but she perceives it as less, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.4: If it has not been determined, but she perceives that it has, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.5: If it has not been assigned to another, but she perceives that it has, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.6: If it has not been given away, but she perceives that it has, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.7: If it is not lost, but she perceives that it is …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.8: If it has not been destroyed, but she perceives that it has …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.9: If it is not broken, but she perceives that it is …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.10: If it has not been stolen, but she perceives that it has, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.11: If she uses an almsbowl that should be relinquished without first relinquishing it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.12: If it is less than one day, but she perceives it as more, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.13: If it is less than one day, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.2.14: If it is less than one day and she perceives it as less, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.3.2: if, before dawn, it is determined, assigned to another, given away, lost, destroyed, broken, stolen, or taken on trust;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.3.4: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:3.1: Soon afterwards the nuns from the group of six did not give back a relinquished bowl.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:3.3: “Monks, a relinquished almsbowl is to be given back.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:3.4: If a nun doesn’t give it back, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:3.5: The first training rule is finished.
